## QueryCheckFailure interface

QueryCheckFailure represents the cause of a pre-execution problem with the query. For example, if a query has malformed syntax the error thrown by the API will include a QueryCheckFailure indicating where this syntax error is.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface QueryCheckFailure
```

## Properties

| Property                                               | Modifiers             | Type                    | Description                                                                                                                            |
| ------------------------------------------------------ | --------------------- | ----------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [annotation?](./fauna.querycheckfailure.annotation.md) | <code>readonly</code> | string                  | <i>(Optional)</i> Further detail about the QueryCheckFailure. Intended to be displayed as an in-line annotation of the error location. |
| [code](./fauna.querycheckfailure.code.md)              | <code>readonly</code> | string                  | A predefined code indicating the type of QueryCheckFailure. See the docs at for a list of codes. Safe for programmatic use.            |
| [location?](./fauna.querycheckfailure.location.md)     | <code>readonly</code> | [Span](./fauna.span.md) | <i>(Optional)</i> A source span indicating a segment of FQL. Indicates where the QueryCheckFailure occured.                            |
| [message](./fauna.querycheckfailure.message.md)        | <code>readonly</code> | string                  | A short, human readable description of the QueryCheckFailure. Not intended for programmatic use.                                       |
